;A long-awaited road has been built an extra 120 meters, becoming an illegal land occupation and will be demolished , wait until the procedures are completed before re-doing it. Why is it so fussy?

;

;According to reports from the Hunan Radio and Television Urban Channel, a new road in Changsha City that nearby residents have long awaited will be opened soon. However, a section of this road was suddenly surrounded again recently, and excavators were excavating the paved asphalt road. Street lights, street trees and other facilities on the roadside were also dismantled and removed, and garbage trucks were also brought in from other places. The loess was transported and poured on the road. What happened?

;

;It turns out that the main part of this road is in Changsha Economic Development Zone, but it extends 120 meters to Furong District. When the Economic Development Zone Urban Construction Company was building the road, it built an extra 120 meters along the way without going through the construction application procedures with the relevant departments of Furong District. The Furong District Natural Resources and Planning Department determined that this was “illegal land occupation.” As a result, the Economic Development Zone Urban Construction Company responsible for the construction began to demolish the road.

;

;According to media reports, staff from the Economic Development Zone Urban Construction Company said that they agreed that the land was indeed being used illegally, but they were "purely out of good intentions." Also, if we don't build more of these 120 meters, there may be no way to connect it with other roads, and there will be a section of "intestinal obstruction" in the middle, so it won't make much sense to build this road, so we "kindly" help and provide money and efforts to complete it. The more than 100 meters of road should be repaired. So when they were deemed illegal by the relevant departments of Furong District, they felt a little aggrieved.

;

;For Furong District, the extra 120 meters of road construction is within my jurisdiction. According to regulations, road construction should follow procedures and be submitted for approval in advance. It is of course illegal to build roads without approval. The competent department requires that the illegal status be eliminated and the construction be restored to its original state. The construction application procedures will be completed before re-repairing, which is completely "in accordance with the law and regulations and in compliance with the procedures."

;

;There seems to be nothing wrong with both sides. However, after construction and demolition, demolition and construction again, a lot of money was wasted. What went wrong?

;

;The Jingkai District Urban Construction Company that built the road built it without approval. Of course, there were violations of laws and regulations. However, the road has been repaired, and it is indeed a road that has been long-awaited by the nearby people and is necessary to be repaired. However, if it is forced to be demolished, the problem may be even greater.

;

;First of all this is a huge waste of public funds. Although the 120-meter road is not long, it costs a lot. The entire road is about 1 kilometer long and costs 60 million yuan. Calculating the cost of 120 meters is 6 to 7 million yuan, and dismantling it will also cost a lot of money. Once it was built or demolished, millions would disappear. This is a municipal road, and the Economic Development Zone Urban Construction Company responsible for its construction is also a state-owned enterprise. The source of its construction funds must be public funds of the local government, that is, public money. For Furong District, it is a good thing that the Economic Development Zone is willing to spend the money to build its own roads. If it is forced to be demolished and then rebuilt by oneself, although the cost of demolition will be borne by the Economic Development District Urban Construction Company, the cost of reconstruction will still be borne by Furong District. It is also incomprehensible to abandon existing roads that have been built with help from others and to dig up and spend money to rebuild them yourself.

;

;Secondly, a section of the repaired road is dug out, and the rest becomes a dead end road. It took three years to build this road, and the nearby people had been waiting for it for three years. It was finally opened, but a section was demolished, and its effectiveness was greatly reduced. If we have to go through the formalities and rebuild it again, I am afraid we will have to wait at least another year and a half. This will bring great inconvenience to the public's travel and will also damage the image of the local government in the public mind.

;

;Requiring the Economic Development Zone to demolish the roads and then rebuild them themselves can be said to be harmful to Furong District and not beneficial to itself. So why do the relevant departments in Furong District do this? From the perspective of organizational behavior, perhaps one or two explanations can be given. For some departments, they must make the decision on their own territory. It is absolutely unacceptable for others to interfere with their boundaries without telling them. Even if you spend more money, you must maintain your authority. After all, if you want to spend money, it is also a financial expense, rather than having to pay out of your own pocket. Only consider issues from the perspective of one place and one department, from the perspective of maintaining the authority of the local area and this department, only consider legal compliance from the perspective of this department, and show your sense of existence.

;

;As for whether the decision made is reasonable from a higher level, whether it will waste financial resources and state-owned assets, waste local taxpayers' money and public interests and perceptions, and consume administrative credibility, it is not considered. scope.

;

;This incident shows the fragmentation and lack of coordination among relevant government departments, the lack of appreciation for the use of fiscal funds, and the lack of care for the waste of state-owned assets. Such things are not uncommon. In the past few years, roads in some cities have been dug up frequently. Today they are laying water pipes, tomorrow they are burying wires, and the day after tomorrow they have to repair sewers. Frequently digging and repairing, repairing and digging again not only wastes construction funds, but also doubles the construction period and brings great inconvenience to citizens' travel.

;

;Fortunately, after the media reports this time, the relevant departments of Changsha Furong District have urgently stopped the behavior of damaging the road surface, and have speeded up the relevant procedures to legalize the 120-meter road as soon as possible. This case has been solved. I hope there will be fewer such absurd things in the future.

;"Is there destined to be a war between China and the United States? My answer Yes, no." Joseph Nye, a professor at Harvard Kennedy School, gave a negative answer.

;

;Joseph Nye is a representative figure of the neoliberal school of international relations. Before and after the Cold War, Joseph Nye was famous for proposing the concept of "soft power". Soft power refers to a country's strength other than economic and military strength, and mainly refers to influence such as culture, values, and public opinion.

;

;He served successively as Assistant Secretary of State in the Carter administration, Chairman of the National Intelligence Council and Assistant Secretary of Defense in the Clinton administration. He is also a leading figure in American politics. But he reminded that the history of mankind is full of situations where wars "accidentally" entered. As long as China and the United States strengthen cooperation and act cautiously, wars can be avoided.

;

;China-US relations are one of the most important bilateral relations in the world today. On October 27, 2023, U.S. President Biden met at the White House with visiting member of the Political Bureau of the Communist Party of China Central Committee and Foreign Minister Wang Yi.

;

;Since October 23, Joseph Nye has embarked on his first visit to China after the COVID-19 epidemic. Judging from the public schedule in just one week, the "Father of Soft Power" has successively attended speeches at many think tanks and universities.

;

;On the afternoon of October 25, in the Qiulin Lecture Hall of the School of International Relations at Peking University, Joseph Nye spoke with the topic "Are China and the United States destined to have a war?" Hundreds of teachers and students discussed "The History and Future of Sino-US Relations." The conference was jointly hosted by the School of International Relations at Peking University and the Institute of International Strategic Studies at Peking University.

;

;Joseph Nye once proposed the "20-year cycle theory of Sino-US relations", that is, since the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and the United States, the ups and downs of the relationship between the two countries have been based on a 20-year cycle. And change.

;

;"In the long run, China and the United States will have better relations. But in the short term, China and the United States still have differences to resolve." Joseph Nye told the South Weekend reporter.

;

;Joseph Nye believes that after 2017, Sino-US relations entered a cycle of great power competition. "China-U.S. relations have gotten worse in the past. In a sense, I think we have seen the deterioration of Sino-U.S. relations, but I hope things will get better." Joseph Nye told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In recent years, discussions about the "new cold war" between China and the United States have been rampant in European and American public opinion circles.

;

;In Joseph Nye's view, the Cold War between China and the United States is completely incommensurable with the Cold War between the United States and the Soviet Union. “During the Cold War between the United States and the Soviet Union, although there was military and political competition between the two countries, their economic and social ties were very sparse. But now China and the United States are highly interdependent in many fields such as economy, society, and ecology. ”

;

;In 2020, Joseph Nye wrote an article in the "Wall Street Journal" that the Cold War between China and the United States is completely avoidable.

;

;Joseph Nye supports China and the United States in strengthening cooperation in public health, climate change and other fields.

;

;"Exchanges between China and the United States should be open to everyone. Exchanges at the cultural and scientific levels are equally important." Joseph Nye told Southern Weekend reporters that he hopes The public's attention should not only focus on high-level people, but also exert soft power. Low-level contacts are also very important.

;

;;The following is an interview with Joseph Nye:;

;

; Sino-US relations have gotten worse in the past. In a sense, we have seen a deterioration in Sino-US relations, but I hope things will get better.

;

;Unfortunately, during the COVID-19 epidemic, communication between China and the United States has not been sufficient. However, communication between China and the United States has begun to change. The United States sent important cabinet members to visit China, and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi also arrived in Washington for a visit.

;

;I think Sino-US relations are making progress. Two years ago, Sino-US relations were worse than they are now. What we're seeing today is some pickup, and I hope it continues.

;

;Among China and the United States, China not only has strong economic performance, but also has the attraction of traditional culture. I believe that a country’s soft power comes not only from government actions but also from civil society.

;

;The U.S. government often does some unpopular things, but despite this, America's civil society remains attractive to others because it is relatively free. Therefore, the soft power of the United States comes more from universities, non-profit organizations, and foundations, such as the Bill Gates Foundation.

;

;It is undeniable that people's views of the United States have gone up and down in recent years. In my opinion, the soft power of the United States has gone up and down. During the Vietnam War and when U.S. troops invaded Iraq, U.S. soft power was declining. The soft power of the United States returned again with the election of Obama as President of the United States in 2008, and fell together with Trump (who became President of the United States) in 2016.

;

;Soft power does not decline linearly or rise linearly. It is often cyclical.

;

;Now, the soft power of the United States is weakening due to internal divisions within the United States. On the other hand, if you look at the hard power of the United States, you will see that the U.S. economy is booming. The United States is a wellspring of innovation, leading in technological fields such as biotechnology and artificial intelligence. Looking at the situation in the Middle East today, (U.S.) military power is still very important.

;

;The Biden administration has been in power for three years and has a more balanced view (compared to the Trump administration). They still believe there are still benefits to working with China.

;

;In May this year, the G7 summit changed its focus on decoupling from China to de-risking on China. This expression means Countries outside the G7 will adopt partial decoupling from China, mostly in the security field.

;

;In other words, de-risking does not mean completely cutting off economic ties, but there are limits. U.S. national security adviser Jake Sullivan called it "building a high wall around a small yard." We should not let this small yard grow.

;

;To prevent deterioration, Sino-US relations should start with high-level contacts. Next, look for areas of cooperation between China and the United States, which can convey to the public of both countries that cooperation with another country is beneficial.

;

;I think this is an area where China and the United States can strengthen cooperation (position on the Russia-Ukraine conflict).

;

;China and the United States can also strengthen cooperation in other areas, such as climate change and working with the WHO to respond to epidemics.

;

;Exchanges between China and the United States should be open to everyone. Obviously, people always focus on the president or the cabinet. Exchange on cultural and scientific levels is equally important. If we need to build trust and cooperation (with each other) and exert soft power, low-level engagement is very important.

;

;(Sino-US relations) have become increasingly complex and difficult to resolve in the short term. I tend to use "short-term pessimists" and "long-term optimists" to describe China and the United States as not posing a threat to each other. In the long run, China and the United States will have better relations. But in the short term, China and the United States still have differences to resolve.

;July 2021, Chongqing Mountain City Trail, sculptures representing Chongqing sticks and traditional stilted buildings. (Visual China/Picture)

;

;"How can a girl become a stickman? How can she afford the work? Go and do something lighter. You're still alive." This is the advice that 51-year-old Huang Xiuli often encounters when carrying goods at Chongqing's Chaotianmen Comprehensive Wholesale Market.

;

;Standing on the heights of Chaotianmen, you can see the intersection of the Jialing River and the Yangtze River. This is the largest water pier in Chongqing. South of the Jialing River and on the north bank of the Yangtze River is the Yangtze River Binjiang Road. On this modern street, there is the Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trading Market, the largest wholesale market gathering place in Chongqing. It is like a streamer, flowing with people buying goods from all over the country. Chongqing’s economy.

;

;The mountainous city of Chongqing has steep roads and few flat areas, and its unique topography provides Bangbang with a living space. "Bangbang" is a Chongqing dialect that originally means "stick". It is a local name for farmers who carry a bamboo stick and engage in heavy manual labor. In the Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trading Market, Bangbangs are responsible for the last link in this economic chain: transportation.

;

;If you look carefully, you can find a few female figures among the sticks passing through the shops in the market. With their hair cut short or in buns, they look sophisticated and sophisticated, just like the men who dominate the industry.

;

;Some of them work alone, and some open "couple teams". In industries where they sell their physical strength to make a living, they often have to deal with employers questioning their "business capabilities." But even so, they don't want to give up the stick.

;

;“Moving things uphill is the most annoying thing”

;

;At Chaotianmen at 6 o'clock in the morning, the freighter on the riverside sounded its whistle, and the truck and asphalt The sound of the road rubbing against each other was more lively than the Chongqing night market.

;

;On September 30, 2023, Huang Xiuli opened the window, and the noise and sunlight penetrated into the room. On the floor were corrugated boxes of pickles and corrugated boxes that Huang Xiuli had collected from various places. Drink bottles and leftovers were scattered on the table... Huang Xiuli picked out this house filled with musty smell one pound at a time. of.

;

;Huang Xiuli has been a "professional player" for 24 years. A stick, a three-meter-long red nylon rope, and a 232 yuan trolley are all her assistants in her work. Every morning at 6:45, Huang Xiuli goes to work in Dazheng Shopping Mall on time. While waiting for orders to come to her door, she and other Bang Bangs set up a gantry formation.

;

;;

;

;In September 2023, Huang Xiuli was transporting goods. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;The employer that Huang Xiuli works with the most is Liu Chunsheng, nicknamed "Liu Youtou". He has been selling men's clothing in Dazheng Shopping Mall for 25 years , with a bulging beer belly and a conspicuous bald head. Every morning when Liu Youtou was sorting out the cargo list, Huang Xiuli came over to help him load and carry the goods bag by bag according to the delivery location.

;

;Liu Youtou agreed to pay 30 yuan per bag, which was the better price Huang Xiuli could get at Chaotianmen Market. One bag weighs 309.6 kilograms, and the straight-line distance is 324 meters - in 2023, Huang Xiuli's effort is worth an average of 9 cents per kilogram.

;

;"It's affordable, usually more than ten yuan." Most of the goods she carries are clothing, which are light in weight and correspondingly priced lower.

;

;According to Huang Xiuli’s experience, you need to use your brain to carry goods and not be reckless. In order to reduce air resistance, she lowered her head when pulling goods; she wore gloves on her hands to increase friction with the cart. "The most annoying thing is carrying things uphill. Carrying it alone makes my head hurt."

;

;In her early years at Chaotianmen, on the way home, Huang Xiuli’s inventory list Her bag was robbed by a motorcycle. "How can I bear it? It's my hard-earned money." In order to keep the money, Huang Xiuli competed with the motorcycle, causing the bones of her upper arm to shift. "I spent thousands, but the doctor didn't give me any money." Cure”.

;

;Later, for unknown reasons, the soles of Huang Xiuli’s feet swelled up. When she woke up, she started to feel pain when she stepped on the ground early in the morning. She thought about inserting acupuncture and applying medicinal wine on her own, but the more treatment she got, the more "irritated" she became. Therefore, Huang Xiuli likes to roll up half of her trouser legs to "air out" her calves.

;

;Due to physical pain, Huang Xiuli would move sideways slowly when lifting large heavy objects uphill or downhill. For a large box over one meter high, Huang Xiuli will first unfold the rope and move it under the heavy object, lift the two ends, cross-tie them and put them on bamboo sticks, and support the goods with both hands while walking. For Huang Xiuli, the body is not only a tool, but also her partner.

;

;At 4 p.m., every merchant in the Chaotianmen Wholesale Market pulled down their rolling shutters. Huang Xiuli hid her sticks and trucks in the mall and went home to cook.

;

;;

;

;Huang Xiuli cannot use it when going uphill or downhill. Push carts require pure manpower to move goods. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;;Feng Shui Treasure Land;   

;

;Huang Xiuli comes from Dianjiang, 120 kilometers away from the main urban area of ​​Chongqing. She is the youngest in her family and has four sisters. When she was in the countryside, Huang Xiuli often dragged her sister's large clothes to the fields to break buds, harvest wheat, and thresh millet.

;

;Even if she works from dawn to dusk in the village, Huang Xiuli earns only enough money to feed herself. She decided to visit the city. The night before leaving Dianjiang, she went to the bamboo forest in the mountains and cut two bamboos, thinking that she would make money from this stick in the future. That night, Huang Xiuli slept with Bangbang in her arms. The next day, she closed the doors and windows and went straight to the city.

;

;Huang Xiuli came to Chaotianmen in 1997. She was 26 years old that year. She had no crow's feet in her eyes, slightly curly black hair, tied with a black rubber band, and was energetic. Capable. The reason why I came to Chaotianmen is because this is the Feng Shui treasure land for Bangbang people to make a fortune.

;

;In 1991, Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trading Market officially opened. By 1997, the market business area had grown from the initial 6,000 square meters to 270,000 square meters, and the number of operating households had grown from more than 500 to more than 10,000. In 1996, the annual transaction volume of the market here reached 3 billion yuan.

;

;At that time, on Chaodong Road where Bangbang lived, Peng Li, who was in charge of Chongqing Bishan Logistics, opened a freight order of more than 20,000 yuan a day. "My joints hurt so much when I started to write," Peng Li said in pain and happiness. Liu You's first day's trade volume can reach more than 30,000 yuan. He describes his orders as being like a train pulling coal with no end in sight.

;

;Gao Zongqi also caught up with this wave of "dividends". In the late 1990s, Gao Zongqi and Lao Zhao, who were from Qijiang, grew corn in their hometown. In the first year, they took their products to the city to sell them, but half of them were robbed before they even entered the city. They lost money. The next year, I took it to the city to sell it and made another loss. I heard that you can make money by helping people carry things in the city, so the couple picked up the stick and went to Chaotianmen. "I can't read, so it's safer to be with my husband." This has been followed in Chaotianmen for 19 years.

;

;At the end of each year, the couple will receive a package fee of 10,000 yuan from their boss. Zhao laughed and said that he also gets a "year-end bonus" like white-collar workers. They relied on this "year-end bonus" to cover the expenses of returning home for the New Year. Gao Zongqi's parents praised their son-in-law for his promise.

;

;Zhao Dongqiu came to Chaotianmen for his son's wife Ben. Thirty years ago, Zhao Dongqiu and her husband opened a retail store in Anyue County, Sichuan. Although they made more money than farming, the couple was still worried about when they would be able to buy a house for their son and marry him.

;

;After chatting with someone, I learned that being a stick can make money quickly. The couple cut two sections of bamboo in their own mountain, scraped off the bamboo skin with a sickle, and wrapped the bamboo around them. We put on tape and nylon rope, bought tickets overnight, and arrived at Chaotianmen in the early morning.

;

;When he first came to Chaotianmen, Zhao Dongqiu's income was only two yuan a day. But she was not in a hurry and wandered around with the rope (rope) on her back. For four months, Zhao Dongqiu wandered around in Chaotianmen and found out about her own "human society": Which family had a girl who was many years old, and which family had a miserable life. She knew clearly, "We must first get familiar with the circle before others can shout It’s up to you, otherwise I can only work on a blank slate (not earning a penny).”

;

;Slowly, 5 yuan, 10 yuan... more and more consignment notes entered Zhao Dongqiu's pocket. In 2003, the "starting price" of Bangbang was 15 yuan, and Zhao Dongqiu and her husband could get orders of more than 10,000 yuan in a month at most. When carrying goods, Zhao Dongqiu often wears jeans, a yellow shirt worth more than 30 yuan, and a thin gold necklace around his neck.

;

;The cakes in Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trade Market are getting bigger and bigger, and there are more and more sticks. Chongqing University's 2010 "Survey on the Living Conditions of Shancheng Bangbang Army" showed that during the most prosperous period, there were approximately 400,000 Bangbangs in Chongqing, of which 3% were women.

;

;;

;

;Chongqing Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trading Market is a large The first stop for most people looking for work. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;Poet Fu Wei once described it this way: In Chongqing, when your friends are drunk, you can ask a stick to carry them back; for your girlfriend’s birthday, You can ask a group of Bangbangs to send flowers and sing a "Happy Birthday" song; if your pet encounters misfortune, you can ask Bangbangs to help cry...

;

;Although they can make money, Bangbang people live frugally. Ms. Liu and her husband have run the only clinic on Chaodong Road for more than 30 years. In Liu’s impression, it was rare for Bangbang to come to see a doctor. Even if he did come, he would always prescribe some medicine for headaches and fever. “They were reluctant to pay for it. I prescribed a pack of Acafol powder for 10 cents, and he asked me if it could be cheaper. ".

;

;“The boss likes to find male bangbangs”

;

;Female bangbangs are not popular in Chaotianmen.

;

;Gao Zongqi said that Huang Xiuli has a graceful appearance and does not look like a physical worker. There is no market for such a girl in Chaotianmen Bangbang. Once a boss thought she was a girl and couldn't afford the work, so Huang Xiuli would talk back: "I can't afford it without paying!"

;

;"I can afford it." So what if you get up? You will be Bangbang for the rest of your life, and I will be the boss for the rest of your life." The sharp-tongued Huang Xiuli shut up when she heard this. Bangbang, who sells his strength, is inseparable from the boss's choice.

;

;"The boss likes to find men to bang." In this industry, physical strength means money. In the Chaotianmen Wholesale Market, bulk goods shopping malls prefer men with physical strength. "They can earn more than 50 per cart, and I earn 30 per order, which is very little." Hard work can make up for weakness, so Huang Xiuli only has to make a few more trips.

;

;Gao Zongqi was very envious of men who could carry toys. "With a lot of money, he could carry my shoes three times in one trip." She came to Chaotian in 1998. Gate, the new Chongqing Chaotianmen International Shoe Center opposite Huang Xiuli carries goods. Gao Zongqi also discussed it with his boss, but the boss still asked Nan Bangbang next time.

;

;Gao Zongqi was not discouraged and packed his shoes honestly, "Their men are too stupid to do such a delicate job." Every time he learned the amount to be packed, Gao Zongqi began to think about how to put the shoe boxes into the box as much as possible horizontally and vertically. If the stuffing is tight, it will affect the presentation; if the stuffing is wide, the top of the box cannot be sealed with glue, and another box may be wasted.

;

;The steps of Gao Zongqi's packing are like putting on makeup: first apply a base layer horizontally, then change the angle of the second layer to apply it over a large area, and finally apply it like filling acne pits , insert a few small shoe boxes into every slot, and finally seal them with glue and tie them. Gao Zongqi raised his "knife" and cut the packing rope in two.

;

;"Hands are easier to use than knives, but the speed must be fast, otherwise there will be blood." Gao Zongqi, who has been a "bat player" for 25 years, can always find the rope quickly The bifurcation point, quickly pull it off. After years of repeated movements, a groove appeared on the joint of Gao Zongqi's index finger.

;

;After the last step of packaging is completed, Gao Zongqi is also responsible for "after-sales", placing the remaining shoes of the shop owner, picking up the garbage, and then pulling the goods to Opposite the inn.

;

;;

;

;Gao Zongqi packs shoes with her husband. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;Female Bangbang will encounter sexual harassment. When they first came to Chaotianmen, Huang Xiuli and Lao Gao rented a house. On the first day they moved in, Bangbang, a man who lived across the street, saw Huang Xiuli and blurted out: "What a good girl!" and wanted to slap her butt.

;

;"Bah! Even if I'm not married, I won't be friends with you. If you don't know the door, just roll the ball." Huang Xiuli thinks she is a straight person, Don't hide your grievances.

;

;The man was so persistent that at 9 o'clock one night, he asked Huang Xiuli out under the pretext of transporting goods.

;

;"I believe you, who wants to transport goods in the middle of the night? If you try to trick me later, I will trick you first." Huang Xiuli usually has a quiet voice. It's big, but sharp and harsh. If it's a little higher, it can scare a table of men.

;

;;The biggest fear is not being able to deliver the goods;

;

;No matter how difficult it is , Huang Xiuli never thought about quitting Bangbang, but it could not stop the industry from declining.

;

;She remembers clearly that after the Wenchuan earthquake in 2008, the Chaotianmen business was abandoned. “Many people were from Sichuan and Chongqing and went home. Everyone has no intention of making money anymore, their lives are at stake.”

;

;The "aftershocks" were delayed until 2010. Chaotianmen Wholesale Market was facing upgrading and comprehensive renovation, and many merchants had the idea of ​​​​moving out of Chaotianmen. "Outside business has been abandoned, and fewer people are coming to buy goods." Liu Youtou recalled.

;

;With the rise of logistics companies, the competition in the door-to-door express delivery service industry is intensifying. In addition, Chongqing’s rail transit is accessible in all directions and private cars are booming. It seems that everyone is competing for the "Bang Bang" rice bowl". There are fewer and fewer sticks carrying bamboo sticks on their shoulders and wandering the streets asking for work.

;

;In 2021, a survey on the living conditions of Bangbang in Chongqing released by the School of Journalism and Communication of Northwest University for Nationalities estimated that the number of Bangbangs in Chongqing has been less than 2,000, and most of them are elderly. Most people.

;

;;

;

;Gao Zongqi and her husband worked together to carry goods, and met a Pokan, passers-by came together to help. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;But Gao Zongqi never thought about changing careers. "I don't know anything, I can only contribute." Gao Zongqi is illiterate. She feels that she will be bullied by the maids in the restaurant, and it also depends on the boss's face, which Gao Zongqi doesn't like. She adapted to not having to "punch in" to work. "Bangbang is free and has no one to care about. If you can afford it, take it. If you don't want to do it, rest."

;

;Huang Xiuli doesn't want to go home either. "It's hard to talk to a female Bangbang when she sees someone she knows." Relatives think that Huang Xiuli would be insulted if she worked as a Bangbang in the city. "I don't feel embarrassed, but they always feel like something is wrong with you. How do they know I made a lot of money?"

;

;Huang Xiuli thought, can As long as you make money, the rest doesn't matter. "It doesn't matter whether it's hard or not, the worst thing is that I won't be able to deliver the goods. I'll have to pay hundreds of dollars a day. Every time the money disappears before it's warm in my pocket."

;

;Huang Xiuli did some calculations: the monthly mortgage of 4,000 yuan needs to be paid on time; her son is studying, and the living expenses of 800 yuan a month cannot be less; her daughter has given birth to a grandson, and neither husband nor wife has a job. , Huang Xiuli and Lao Gao provide 2,000 yuan per month. In order to occupy a place in the mall, Huang Xiuli also needs to pay 2,000 yuan "land fee" to the mall every year - occupying a 7-square-meter plot of 15 tiles, where Huang Xiuli's son sits and waits for his mother in his free time. Playing with mobile phones. Including water, electricity, property and food expenses, Huang Xiuli feels that it takes about 8,000 yuan per month to open her home.

;

;September, October, and November every year are the replacement seasons of Chaotianmen Clothing Market. In previous years, it was also the golden period for Bangbang people to make money. But this year, there were no cargo loads after two or three days. According to Lao Zhao, you can’t even pay for water now. Liu Youtou also made up his mind to return to his hometown.

;

;Peng Li is still sitting on the small bench by the roadside, but now she can only issue freight orders of more than 2,000 yuan a day. Huang Xiuli often secretly picks up corrugated cardboard when she gets off work. Gao Zongqi still sits at Chaotianmen International Shoes Co., Ltd. waiting for goods at 6 o'clock every day, and his breakfast has changed from two buds to one. "If you don't have money to earn, don't eat in vain."

;

;There are fewer sticks, and there are even fewer female sticks. Southern Weekend visited and found that there are currently 8 female baseball players in Chaotianmen, 4 of whom are responsible for shoes in the new Chongqing Chaotianmen International Shoe Store, 1 is moving clothes in the third trading area of ​​the shopping mall, and 3 are mobile On Chaodong Road, it mainly transports foreign goods. There are four women in Sanxia Square, two of whom often wait for goods at the entrance of Chongqing New Century Supermarket, and two of whom follow their husbands everywhere to buy goods. There is a female stick worker at the Caiyuanba Bus Station. She closes her stall in the afternoon during the peak season and returns in the morning during the off-season.

;

;When asked where the more female fans went and how many female fans there are in the area now, their answers were all "I don't know." ""not sure". In other Bangbang gathering places such as Guanyinqiao, Baiyakou Street, Shibati, etc., Southern Weekend did not find any female Bangbangs.

;

;Zhao Dongqiu has already saved enough money for her son's daughter-in-law, but she still doesn't want to leave Chaotianmen. Someone once took a fancy to Zhao Dongqiu's cleverness and asked her to settle accounts, but Zhao Dongqiu declined, "It's easier to have fun here, and you can blow everyone off (chat)". Zhao Dongqiu's goal now is to "get off work" after earning 100 yuan a day.

;

;Huang Xiuli still insists on going out every day to find work. Before going out in the morning, she would put homemade medicinal wine on her feet, believing that her home remedies would be more effective than seeing a doctor. "Life is difficult, but I still hope that life will get better."

;

;Watching "The Mistake by the River" for the first time , still in Cannes. It was raining lightly in the early morning. Director Wei Shujun thanked everyone for coming to watch the movie before the movie started. He said that it was also raining in the first scene of the movie.

;

;;;

;;The opening rain scene of the film takes us back to the southern town in the 1990s. The cold weather, dilapidated buildings, dim light, and cramped alleys, the space presented in the film The texture is distant yet familiar. A series of bizarre murder cases lead the pursuers of the truth into the abyss of madness. ;

;

;;As a shortlisted film in this year's Cannes "Un Certain Regard" section, "The Mistake by the River" scored a high score of 3.5 points in the Cannes program;< span>;. As the opening film of the just-concluded Pingyao International Film Festival, this film once again received high praise from many film critics. ;Since the short film "Yanbian Boy" debuted in Cannes in 2018, in just 5 years, every feature film directed by Wei Shujun has been favored by Cannes. Such excellent results are rare among the post-90s generation of directors. Its right. ;;

;

;;Wei Shujun’s first two works, "The Parting of the Wild Horse's Mane" and "Stories of Yong'an Town", have a very obvious personal color, not only in terms of plot, but also in the story. This kind of personal experience narration also includes a preference for meta-film narrative. Cannes' favor is undoubtedly a recognition of Wei Shujun's creative talent and potential, but these two previous works are still young and immature. ;

;

;;

;

;;The "Mistake by the River" shows a self-contained temperament, marking Wei Shujun's maturity in creation. Of course, on the one hand, this is due to the original novels with more humanistic value and interpretation space provided by Yu Hua. On the other hand, it is also the more professional and skilled performance of the creative team under the control of industrialization and commerciality. ;

;

;;

;

;;"The Mistake by the River" is a pioneering experimental novella, published in 1988, and is Yu Hua's early work. Yu Hua mentioned in the interview that Lu Xiaoya and Zhang Yimou both wanted to adapt this work, but neither of them came to fruition, which proves the difficulty of adapting this novel into a movie. ;

;

;;When describing the creative process of "Alive", Wang Bin mentioned that the first thing he recommended to Zhang Yimou was "The Mistake by the River" by Yu Hua. At that time, "Alive" Not fully published yet. After reading it, Zhang Yimou worried that the characters in "The Mistake by the River" were too symbolic. In the process of continuous discussion, Zhang Yimou also constructed an almost brand-new story, with more realistic characters and plots, and obviously more Zhang Yimou's style - this story has a female as the protagonist. It's just that this idea went nowhere. Zhang Yimou was later completely attracted by "Alive", thus creating a classic in Chinese film history. ;

;

;After more than thirty years, in the hands of a younger generation of creators, "The Mistake by the River" has taken on a new glory. Wei Shujun and screenwriter Kang Chunlei's adaptation has no concerns of the times or historical considerations. Baggage is a bold addition, deletion, disassembly and reconstruction based on the original work. It not only grasps the absurd nature of the original work, but also injects it with an expression that is closer to the current mental state.

;

;;;

;;The pursuit of the truth in Yu Hua's original work is the author's analysis of madness and civilization during the cultural renaissance wave in the late 1980s. The protagonist Ma Zhe was eventually diagnosed as a "madman". It is an ironic social naming. In the movie version, as Ma Zhe gradually becomes a madman, he encounters individuals being crushed by authority, the uncertainty of memory, and black humorous coincidences in the process of solving crimes. Near the end of the movie, a change of viewpoint in one shot shows that Ma Zhe has finally become a madman, and is even more proactive than Ma Zhe in the novel. ;

;

;;In that era in my memory, lunatics were common. Some liked to sing in the yard late at night, and some liked to tease others on the street. In today's era, we almost no longer see lunatics in public places, but more and more people entertain themselves as "mentally ill." The different understandings of the symptoms of "madman" in the two eras may correspond to the different spiritual cores displayed by the two generations of creators in their treatment of novels and film texts. ;

;

;;

;

;Yu Hua said, "Only fools are loyal to the original work." The movie "The Mistake by the River" is a smart and successful adaptation. The realistic texture created by Wei Shujun visually highlights the absurdity and the eerie atmosphere that makes people think deeply. The 16mm film shooting gives the film a retro tone, presenting the sense of small town space of that era, with occasional out-of-focus lenses, and even provides a stylistic expression for the theme of uncertainty. ;

;

;;The film's representation of the people and events in the unit of that era, as well as scenes such as the poetry meeting, is by no means a realistic reproduction. The director uses a slightly exaggerated satire, but more subtly conveys the reality of the times that makes people laugh. ;

;

;;Ma Zhe, played by Zhu Yilong, also provides a wonderful screen image for this retro realistic texture. In order to interpret this role more accurately, Zhu Yilong went to Nanfeng, the filming location, to experience life in advance. He found inspiration for his appearance from an old photo of Yu Hua, and first gained weight and then lost weight for this role. His experiential performance created an amazing character. A convincing image of Ma Zhe. So far, this role is the biggest screen breakthrough for Zhu Yilong, who is still labeled as a traffic star, and will lay the foundation for his future as a big screen actor. In other words, we see one thing from him: acting skills are more important than traffic.

;

;;;

;;;Wei Shujun, who prefers meta-movies, said that "The Mistake by the River" is no longer a meta-movie. ;However, in the film, a movie theater that is about to be demolished is used as the working space for handling the case. The gaze and being gazed created by the camera's perspective, as well as the presentation of the chaos of dreams and reality, all demonstrate the director's meta-cinematic interest. . ;

;

;;Similar to the original work, "The Mistake by the River" has a detective-themed genre shell, but the direction of the plot and the author's stylized treatment broke the expectations of genre suspense. . Moreover, it also abandons the avant-garde nature of the original work and uses a linear narrative as the main line, but it is by no means in line with the public's imagination. Therefore, we need to look at the market performance of this movie with caution. But regardless of whether it's good or bad at the box office, this is a work with a unique temperament. ;

;

;;

;

;; (Andrea Rossetti/Picture) ;

;

;Among the "post-90s" who are active in the contemporary art circle, Sun Yidian is undoubtedly the lucky one who has a good hand. She is the kind of international artist favored by galleries and academic institutions. The creator is also the darling of fashion brands and the collection market. Her works involve painting, installation, performance, and fashion cross-border... In her twenties, not long after leaving the Central American School, she was named "Outstanding Youth Under 30" by Forbes Asia ", and in the past two years, he has won the "Young Artist of the Year" from The Best of Best in 2022 and the "Outstanding Creator of the Year" from the Chinese version of the Wall Street Journal in 2022-2023.

;

;2023 will be an intense year for Sun Yidian. She returned to school and studied for a doctorate in literature and art at Tsinghua University. She has continued domestic group exhibitions and overseas exhibitions. In April, she held a solo exhibition in Berlin. Portrait" opens, followed by the solo exhibition "Once Upon a Time" in Paris on October 17th (;"Once Upon a Time"; ). Her iconic plastic dolls come from Western pop culture, but also contain Eastern codes. They have formed a unique accent in the old building of the landmark Place Fontaine in Paris: foreign viewers will smell the familiarity of the illustrations. A subtle touch of exoticism.

;

;Ph.D. supervisor Wang Minan once suggested that she complete her doctoral studies in a dual-thread approach: painting during the day and studying at night. But in fact, it is difficult to operate. "Painting is still very brain-burning. After painting for a whole day, it is really difficult to read academic works at night." So she divided the time into different intervals: before the exhibition, she would retreat and paint intensively. , and then start the academic mode after all the paintings have been shipped.

;

;;

;

;2018, "A twinkle", Shanghai, BANK Gallery

;

;Five Ren Studio in Beijing

;

;In September, Wu Hongce In the "Crossing Boundaries - Possibilities and Echoes" exhibition at the Yuz Museum, Sun Yizhen met again with her previous work "Pink Dinosaur with Blue Wings", which was her work around 2017. The entire "man-made object" "The representative work shortly after the series started, "I have never seen it again after the exhibition." When I met face to face in the exhibition hall five years later, "it was exactly the same as seeing a long-lost friend or child. "

;

;"You will recall the scene when you painted it, and even recall every stroke you drew. That moment was 3 o'clock in the afternoon, and when you drew that stroke, the sun happened to shine. The place where you put down the pen, yes, suddenly, that memory was retrieved from your subconscious..."

;

;The memories all came back in an instant, and a painting opened the door to the past for her. A wormhole, not only about that painting, but also a whole set of life wrapped up in that painting: At that time, she was still in graduate school, and she shared a studio in Feijia Village with her friends at the time. There was an artificial pond there. In summer, the pond is crowded with lotus leaves and lotus flowers, and people living around it are all engaged in art. The next door neighbor is a dancer and a photographer. They visit each other all day long, go fishing in the pond, and eat big pot rice: stewed turtle, spicy crayfish... …spent many lively nights, like a utopia.

;

;It is an elegy for collective life, which died out almost simultaneously with the student days. "Now I have no collective life, only work is left." On the wall of the studio with small sketches, you can see the work Traces of madness: The exhibition schedule is accurate to every day, and is made into a list and posted in a conspicuous place; in an inconspicuous place, a whole row of "45" is densely written in pencil, and many of the "45" have been crossed out. ——This is the way good student Sun Yidian forces herself to focus on painting. She believes that every 45 minutes is a period of concentration. This is how the school's classes are set up. After every 45 minutes of serious painting, she will She crossed it out and allowed herself a small recess: she once liked using highly saturated fluorescent colors, which overloaded her eyes after long hours of homework and staring.

;

;;

;

;"Crossing Boundaries: Possibilities and Echoes" exhibition view, Yuz Museum, Shanghai, 2023;(Alessandro Wang, Yuz Museum/Photo );

;

;This is Sun Yidian’s fifth studio in Beijing, and it is also the one she considers “the most luxurious”. The so-called luxury means that it has heating and air conditioning, and has a high roof, ceiling windows, which bring in stable natural light, and large-open doors to facilitate the transportation of large-scale works. The second and third floors are storage rooms and bedrooms. There is a shelf large enough to store her past works, and a bed where she can lie down when she stays up late to paint - this is all an easel artist desires.

;

;Other studios before can only be described as crude and homeless. She would count them on her fingers: the first studio was in Ark Court, a residential building next to Central Academy of Fine Arts. The space and light were cramped, and it was impossible to display large paintings. The size of the painting was slightly larger, and the relationship between colors was inconsistent. The depth is just not right. The second one was in Feijia Village. It was a happy time, but it was demolished and a group of artists were driven away as if they were being expelled. The third studio was near the turkey factory. One summer there was a sudden flood and most of her paintings were soaked. So she fled there and moved to the mainland. The fourth studio has no heating in winter and no air conditioning in summer. She spent three winters in this ice cave, painting with her feet on a small electric carpet. Her hands became cold and stiff after a while, so she could only put them under her buttocks to warm them up before continuing to paint. Her mother came to see her from Wenzhou and felt the extremely cold weather that had never been seen in the south. At night, the surroundings of the studio were pitch black and there were no street lights. She couldn't help shouting: Daughter! What kind of sin have you suffered here? !

;

;;

;

;"Once upon a time" Acrylic on canvas, 205cmx158cm, 2023

;

;A painting can be painted this way, or it can be painted that way

;

;Mother He was probably the first person to provide artistic support to Sun Yidian. When she was a child, her parents enrolled her in many interest classes. She was the child who cried when she saw she was about to play the piano, but she was very active in painting. She started studying painting at the age of 4. When she was in elementary school, her parents let her attend Wenzhou Youth Art School.

;

;In other provinces in China, this kind of professional art school for primary school students is extremely rare, which corresponds to the strong demand for folk art education in the southeastern coast. These primary school students are cultivated by an almost omnipotent art concept. They have to learn Chinese painting as well as Western painting. Sketching, coloring, and sketching are all necessary basic skills. They have to go to the countryside to sketch, and they have to hand in calligraphy homework every week. "Our primary school has actually trained many people. For example, the Asian Games torch was designed by our seniors, including architects and artists currently active in Zhejiang. If you ask, many of them came from this primary school."

; < p>;In the art circle, it is very strange to praise a person with "top student", but Sun Yidian has indeed been a top student all the way. Her elementary school does not relax its requirements for cultural courses just because it majors in art. Many students will later go to ordinary middle schools and comprehensive universities, and not all of them may be bent on becoming art students. Sun Yidian was admitted to Wenzhou Middle School, the best local high school, but at the same time, she also received admission notices from the National High School Affiliated to the National Academy of Arts and the Central American High School Affiliated to the Art Examination.

;

;;

;

;"Simple Shed" watercolor on paper, 25.3cmx19.1cm, 2009

;

;She chose the High School Affiliated to Central Academy of Fine Arts because she could go to Beijing and legitimately "leave" Parents stay away."

;

;For Sun Yidian, the High School Affiliated to Central Academy of Fine Arts is a free and magical place. She seemed to be suddenly opened up to a whole new world and new senses to match it. She is still amazed that she watched so many niche movies and so many esoteric books that were inappropriate for her age when she was in the attached middle school. "There are many big boring movies that I can't stand now, but I actually watched them wholeheartedly at that time. Many of them In fact, I only know a little about philosophy books, so I just read them hard to pretend to be cool. People around me don’t listen to pop music. They all listen to very literary and niche things to show that they are different.” In the attached middle school, not being mainstream is a kind of mainstream. These hard-to-eat nutrients have unknowingly become part of her background. “The biggest inspiration for my art is that I am willing to try anything and be interested in everything. After a person is suddenly opened up at that age, he realizes , It turns out that a painting can be done this way or that way."

;

;She still keeps a collection of sketches from when she was in the attached middle school. At that time, she had to submit a large number of sketches every week, and the teacher would write on the handed-in homework. The stamp indicates that it has been read, preventing students from submitting previous works for submission. In order to catch up on the huge amount of homework, they would go to Beijing Railway Station to stay up all night and paint the passengers who stayed at the station overnight. Foreigners from all over the world come in all shapes and sizes, and they don't move even after falling asleep due to fatigue. They are ready-made models at your fingertips. When she returned home during the summer vacation, while her mother was taking a bath, she was doing sketches of human figures. Her mother calmly let her do the painting without any hesitation.

;

;After graduating from the High School Affiliated to the Central Academy of Fine Arts, she was recommended to the Central Academy of Fine Arts. Her college entrance examination scores in cultural subjects were surprisingly high among art students. After graduating from Central America, he was directly recommended to graduate school at Central America. Sun Yidian said that she is the kind of person with strong self-motivation, and her academic career is just "going with the flow". It was also out of self-consciousness that after working as an artist for several years, she went to Tsinghua University to study for a Ph.D.

;

;;

;

;"Ken" acrylic on wood, 45.5cmx38cm, 2019

;

;Natural objects and man-made objects

;

;Sun Yidian is well-known and has the best market performance The series is "artificial objects", and most of the pictures are inflatable or plastic toys, but she also has a secret "natural objects" series, which she started to create when she was 16 years old, a series oriented "from the deep", including flowers and fruits. , mountains, rivers, and trees have all become the objects of her gaze and representation. But the "natural objects" have never been exhibited. Sun Yidian hangs them on the wall of his studio, like a private archive.

;

;"Man-made objects" are dazzling floats above the water, and "natural objects" are like anchors underwater.

;

;"Many people came to my studio and liked the 'Natural Objects' series. Last time a sister came over and said that this group of small paintings made her cry." She incorporated a lot of elements into this series. For media experiments, I like to use some children’s handmade materials, such as a kind of baby foam beads called “pearl mud”, which can be used for shaping and is also a common raw material in toy factories. Later, I discovered a Japanese paper pulp clay that has excellent modeling power and durability, and can create a spatial effect similar to a bas-relief on the painting.

;

;;

;

;"Let Me Hug" Acrylic on canvas, 200cmx133cm, 2015

;

;The "Artificial Objects" series made her famous in one fell swoop. The smooth, plump, grotesque and falsely sweet toys she draws have won her a steady stream of attention and collectors, and their prices have skyrocketed. As a child in Wenzhou, her childhood memories are all kinds of man-made objects. "When I was a kid, when we said we were going to play at a classmate's house, what we actually meant was: go play in your family's factory."

;

;Almost every household has a factory, including a shoe factory. , glasses factory, plastic products factory, lighter factory... Occasionally there are toy factories. There are not many toy factories, but the visual impact on a child is huge. These small commodity factories all retain a simple production layout. The factory building often has several bedrooms attached. The home is also the same as the factory. After the reform and opening up, materials, and the production brought about by materials, sprouted up everywhere in Wenzhou like bamboo shoots after a rain. What’s interesting is that her international collectors are also very sympathetic to these things she painted. They told Sun Yidian: The era when the artificial objects you painted suddenly exploded in abundance, maybe the 1990s in China. But in Europe and the United States, it was our 1960s. It is precisely because of this that they feel the same complex flavor of nostalgia and reflection in Sun Yidian's paintings.

;

;This kind of commonality is not uncommon in Sun Yidian’s paintings, like a hidden cultural code. She paints huge idols. Their appearance and facial features are common in Western pop culture. However, the curved eyebrows and single eyelids come from traditional Chinese painting. The angle of the lips, which seems to be smiling but not smiling, is her classic image based on Buddhist sculptures. drawn. This image appears on the exhibition wall, facing the viewer in a overlooking manner. Regardless of whether the viewer is an Easterner or a Westerner, they will be slightly stunned and realize that something seems wrong in a sense of déjà vu. The "Porcelain Mother" she painted is a small white porcelain statue with hands clasped together, standing silently among the roots of the trees. This is a common porcelain Madonna ornament in Western families, but strangely, it also Much like the Dehua white porcelain Guanyin worshiped in Chinese homes.

;

;Sun Yidian said that in her hometown, the belief system is complex. When she was a child, her family worshiped Buddha and worshiped Guanyin all year round. However, when she came to her uncle's house, he believed in Catholicism and kept a statue of the Virgin Mary in his home. As a child, she often felt confused. In her eyes, there was no essential difference between the kind and compassionate female faces. The localization of handicrafts has deepened this aesthetic mutual reference. A priest often came and went from her uncle's house. Apart from his detached and indifferent expression, she could not see any difference between the priest and ordinary neighbors. The same goes for the local church, which is European in form but with a strong Chinese decoration style.

;

;She is keen to examine these common clues in different cultures out of curiosity about images. She painted Medusa and looked through Caravaggio and other classic paintings in the album. The snakes on Medusa's head were all live snakes. The artist had to focus on painting the twisting and entangled violence, lifelike, that is culture. Classic output to her symbols. In her private memory, Medusa only saw the logo on her mother's Versace bag when she was a child. She was surprised at that time. Why use the head of a strange woman as a label? In order to draw her own Medusa, she bought a bunch of rubber and plastic coiled snakes online as a reference. Their ferocity and beauty were just a bluff - "I just wanted to draw them all as fake snakes, realistic fake ones." ."

;

;Her workbench is filled with these artificial toys, which have also become the prototypes in her paintings: original Barbie, pirated Barbie, Ken with his head ripped off, naked Ken... The first time she drew Ken with only a head, she shocked everyone and triggered a big discussion including hot words such as "feminism", "female revenge", "consumer men", and "female reverse gaze", but she Frankly speaking, I painted my friend as Ken just for visual reasons, which is like playing house on the canvas.

;

;;

;

;"Evening" wood board composite material, 20cmx20cm, 2016

;

;The world is seven centimeters shorter

;

;Sun Yidian has always been interested in gender issues All are there. When she was in college, she asked acquaintances in her hometown to let her go to the obstetrics and gynecology hospital to observe women giving birth. It was the largest obstetrics and gynecology hospital in Wenzhou and the place where she was born. She saw groups of women rolling and moaning on the delivery bed. Their faces were blurred, and all their female characteristics were hidden. What mattered was the huge bulge in the middle of the body and the birth canal that was about to burst, as if that was their only thing at the moment. Biological attributes, their common identity and destiny. She turned this feeling into a series of works, titled "Coming Soon." That year, she was 22 years old.

;

;What is "coming" may be new life, or the adult life she is about to enter. But for Sun Yidian, "coming soon" is more like a moment in nature, "In my hometown, there are many thunderstorms in the south, the kind of heavy rainstorms that suddenly fall, and the sky is so dark that the day seems like night, The raindrops were huge, pouring, and then there was lightning and thunder. I have many such memories when I was a child. I stood under the window of my house and looked at the heavy rain outside. The sky suddenly lightened up, and then there was a burst of thunder from the distance. . My 'coming soon' is the moment when the lightning has flashed and the thunder has not yet come. I am nervous and scared, but I am also looking forward to that moment coming."

;

;She did not explain her scene, no matter how It’s up to the viewers to draw their own interpretations, whether it’s gender issues, pop culture issues, material issues, consumerism issues... She is at ease with everything. Just like her painting "Porcelain Mother", those who believe in Guanyin see Guanyin and the Mother of God. What the viewer sees is the Virgin. She believes that any viewing will first reflect the viewer’s cultural memory and information reserve, rather than the creator’s intention.

;

;As her doctoral thesis was about to be started, Wang Minan suggested that she write about consumerism. The implication was that it was related to the topic she drew, and it would be easier for her to gain insights when writing. She also thought it was reasonable. She is just worried that her logical ability is not strong - the academic construction of writing a paper and the picture composition that she is so familiar with are completely different things. Teacher Wang sometimes asks her from the perspective of "consumption": I heard that one of your paintings has sold for millions? She was so frightened that she only waved her hands: Teacher, teacher, let’s never talk about this.

;

;;

;

;"Porcelain Mother" Acrylic on wood, 54cm x 45cm, 2023

;

;Zhang Ailing said that you must become famous as early as possible. Sun Yidian agreed with both hands, but her reasons were different from Zhang Ailing. What she worries about is not that success comes too late and the taste is not sweet enough, but she believes that becoming famous at a young age can give people a valuable sense of relaxation and allow them to do art more calmly and comfortably. Those artists who have been tortured by fate for too long and have struggled to overcome all kinds of struggles are sometimes inevitably distorted by the desire for success and the pressure of survival, leading to deformed movements and making incredible choices.

;

;“Only the income from selling paintings in my first exhibition was meaningful to me, because it meant that I could support myself and become an independent artist. Before that, I had always followed My parents were vaccinated and asked to be mentally prepared that I might not have a job after graduation and would have to go home to grow old. That money gave me great freedom. The happiness from money ended here. After that, I sold Any high price offered is just a number to me."

;

;She naturally realized that as long as the female artists of her generation made some progress in their careers, they would inevitably work for all women. speak out. "When a female artist becomes famous at a young age, it is easy for others to say: Is it because of your appearance? Is there someone behind you who is helping you raise the price?" Is it impossible for women to achieve success based on their strength alone? Is it hard to acknowledge the excellence of women? Sun Yidian's way of fighting back is to use more comprehensive self-strength to shut them up. He wrote about the feelings of girls when they wear high heels - "The world is seven centimeters shorter."

;
